newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times page one stories.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times page one stories.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following stories on its front page on Friday:
* The Congressional Budget Office revised its estimate of future Medicaid costs, which eases pressure on cutting health benefits for the poor.
* An Atlanta abortion clinic was struck by two bombs, injuring six people.
* Israel's parliament approved the Hebron agreement to turn the West Bank city over to the Palestinians.
* South Korean workers are prospering, but a change in the labour laws is threatening job security. Korean workers are finding themselves in the same position as workers in other industrial nations.
* A second trial for the 1991 stabbing of a Hasidic Jew has started.
* Australia's F.A.I. Insurances Ltd agreed to turn its St. Moritz Hotel into condominiums, with Donald Trump providing marketing and development expertise.
* Raytheon Co has agreed to acquire Hughes Electronics Corp from General Motors Corp for $9.5 billion in stock and new debt.
